example: SELECT * FROM users;
description: Retrieves data from a database.

example: INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES ('John Doe', 'john@example.com');
description: Inserts new data into a database.

example: UPDATE users SET email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE name = 'John Doe';
description: Updates existing data in a database.

example: DELETE FROM users WHERE name = 'John Doe';
description: Deletes data from a database.

example: SELECT * FROM users;
description: Retrieves all records from the 'users' table.

example: INSERT INTO users (name, email) VALUES ('John', 'john@example.com');
description: Inserts a new record into the 'users' table with specified values.

example: UPDATE users SET email = 'john.doe@example.com' WHERE name = 'John';
description: Updates the 'email' field of the user named 'John'.

example: DELETE FROM users WHERE name = 'John';
description: Deletes the record of the user named 'John' from the 'users' table.

example: CREATE TABLE users (id INT AUTO_INCREMENT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), email VARCHAR(255));
description: Creates a new 'users' table with columns for 'id', 'name', and 'email'.

example: DROP TABLE users;
description: Deletes the 'users' table from the database.

example: ALTER TABLE users ADD COLUMN age INT;
description: Adds a new 'age' column to the 'users' table.

example: SELECT users.name, orders.amount FROM users INNER JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id;
description: Performs an INNER JOIN between the 'users' and 'orders' tables based on matching 'user_id'.

example: SELECT users.name, orders.amount FROM users LEFT JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id;
description: Retrieves all records from 'users', and the matching records from 'orders'.

example: SELECT users.name, orders.amount FROM users RIGHT JOIN orders ON users.id = orders.user_id;
description: Retrieves all records from 'orders', and the matching records from 'users'.

example: CREATE DATABASE mydatabase;
description: Creates a new database called 'mydatabase'.

example: DROP DATABASE mydatabase;
description: Deletes the 'mydatabase' from the MySQL server.

example: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON mydatabase.* TO 'user'@'localhost';
description: Grants all privileges on 'mydatabase' to 'user' at 'localhost'.

example: REVOKE ALL PRIVILEGES ON mydatabase.* FROM 'user'@'localhost';
description: Revokes all privileges on 'mydatabase' from 'user' at 'localhost'.

example: SHOW TABLES;
description: Displays a list of all tables in the current database.

example: DESCRIBE users;
description: Displays the structure of the 'users' table.

example: USE mydatabase;
description: Selects 'mydatabase' for subsequent operations.
